pages.title: ⤝ Page of Swords ⤝
pages.text: Lotus of the Palace of Air$(br)       $(m)∇$() Earth of $(m)∆$() Air

A nimble figure holds a sword upright in both hands, while in the act of swift walking.$(br)  They pass over rugged land, and in the night sky the clouds dash wildly.$(br)  He is alert, looking this way and that, as if an expected enemy might find them at any moment.$(br)  However much we believe that we think clearly and objectively, much of our thinking derives from desire, fear, or simply instinct.

How we think about the world, is but an abstraction of it. As a famous maxim puts it 'the map is not the territory.'$(br)  We must scout unknown territory, confronting uncertainty, if we are to be sure of our grasp. $(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Overseeing, vigilance, spying.$(br)  May signify someone who is active in the world, but in an intellectual, detached way; or who believes they are

objective, but are driven by desires or fears.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Requirement for greater awareness of your own motives.$(br)  Can mean suspicion or nervousness.$(br)  Can signify a less intellectual, more instinctive, active and detached person.
